ARABIC: وَأَنَّكَ لَا تَظْمَؤُا۟ فِيهَا وَلَا تَضْحَىٰ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: You will not go thirsty in it or burn in the sun.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Nor thirst nor exposure to the sun."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: nor face thirst or scorching heat."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: thirst, or exposure to the hot Sun."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And that you never feel thirsty nor hot sunshine hurt you.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And you (will) suffer not from thirst therein nor from the sun's heat."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And that you shall not be thirsty therein nor shall you feel the heat of the sun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: neither to thirst therein, nor to suffer the sun.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And that thou thirstest not therein nor art exposed to the sun's heat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: you shall not thirst, nor feel the sun's heat."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Nor that thou shalt thirst therein nor shall suffer from the sun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: You will neither be thirsty in it, nor suffer from [the heat of] the sun.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Nor to suffer from thirst, nor from the sun's heat."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And you (will) suffer not from thirst therein nor from the sun's heat.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: there, (you shall) neither thirst, nor suffer from the sun'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Nor will you be thirsty in it, nor will you swelter.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And indeed, you will not be thirsty therein or be hot from the sun."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [20:119] And it is indeed [assured] for you (read wa-annaka or wa-innaka, as a supplement to the subject of inna [sc. laka, that is, ‘you’] and its clause) neither to be thirsty therein, nor to suffer the sun’: you will not be exposed to any heat of a midday sun, for there is no sun in Paradise.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And that thou thirstest not therein nor are exposed to the sun's heat) He says: you are not going to sweat.
